results.title: San Bernardino Couple Spoke of Attacks in 2013, F.B.I. Says
results.abstract: The F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, said Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik had talked of jihad and martyrdom before they started courting online.
results.byline: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and SALMAN MASOOD
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

results.title: Officials Scrutinize Buyer of Guns Used in California Attack
results.abstract: Enrique Marquez, a former neighbor of Syed Rizwan Farook, bought the two assault rifles that Mr. Farook and his wife used in a deadly rampage in San Bernardino.
results.byline: By RICK ROJAS and IAN LOVETT

results.title: France Identifies 3rd Attacker at Concert Hall
results.abstract: The assailant is said to have been a 23-year-old from the Strasbourg area in northeastern France who left for Syria with a group of would-be jihadists in late 2013.
results.byline: By ADAM NOSSITER, ALISSA J. RUBIN and AURELIEN BREEDEN
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

results.title: Trump’s Plan to Bar Muslims Is Widely Condemned Abroad
results.abstract: Donald J. Trump’s proposal to bar Muslims drew condemnation from Europe and beyond, as well as questions about the direction of the United States.

results.title: ‘I’m a Warrior for the Babies,’ Suspect Shouts in Colorado
results.abstract: Robert L. Dear Jr. disrupted a court hearing where he was charged with 179 counts in the Planned Parenthood shooting that left three people dead in Colorado Springs.

results.title: Justices Voice Doubts on Affirmative Action
results.abstract: A majority of the Supreme Court justices seemed unpersuaded on Wednesday that an affirmative action plan at the University of Texas was constitutional.

results.title: Rubio’s Legislative Move Undermines Health Law Quietly
results.abstract: A provision slipped into a 2014 spending law by Senator Marco Rubio has tangled up the Obama administration and sent tremors through health insurance markets.
des_facet: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

multimedia.caption: Senator Marco Rubio at a campaign event in Greenland, N.H., last week. He attached a provision limiting how much the government can spend to protect insurance companies against financial losses to a spending law last year.

results.title: They Helped Erase Ebola in Liberia. Now They’re Being Erased.

results.title: Senate Sends Obama Overhaul of No Child Left Behind Law
results.abstract: President Obama is expected to sign the bill, which would restore authority for school performance and accountability to districts and states after a long period of federal control.

multimedia.caption: “I believe it inaugurates a new era of innovation and student achievement," Senator Lamar Alexander of Tennessee, who leads the Education Committee, said Tuesday of the No Child Left Behind bill.

results.title: Hundreds Evacuated From Rebel Foothold in Homs
results.abstract: Hundreds of people were evacuated from the last rebel-held pocket of the central Syrian city devastated by years of fighting and blockades.
results.byline: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

results.title: Yahoo to Spin Off Core Businesses
results.abstract: Yahoo has decided to keep its Alibaba stake and will instead look at transferring its other assets into a new company.

multimedia.caption: With Marissa Mayer as chief executive, Yahoo has made dozens of acquisitions and added original video and magazine-style content. But its core Internet operations are still struggling.

results.title: First Dengue Fever Vaccine Approved by Mexico
results.abstract: The vaccine, called Dengvaxia, has been developed by Sanofi. Dengue fever can cause high temperature and intense joint and muscle pain.

multimedia.caption: A young woman with dengue fever is watched over by her mother in a Pakistani hospital. An estimated 50 million to 100 million people a year are sickened by the disease.

results.title: Unresolved Issues as Climate Deadline Nears
results.abstract: Lead negotiators said they were confident that a deal could still be reached, but observers said the compromises necessary to do so could weaken the deal so much as to make it nearly toothless.

results.title: The Best Albums of 2015
results.abstract: This year offered winning releases from familiar faces, global flavor and meditations on nature. Our music critics share their picks for the best pop and jazz albums of the year.

results.title: Online Loop of Action and Reaction Is Worsening
results.abstract: Wouldn’t it have been kind of a pleasant dream world, in these overheated last few weeks, to have lived free of social media?
